intro: Cochlearia olyssiponensis, commonly known as the Azores horned poppy, is a rare flowering plant native to the Azores Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its distinctive yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
